<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- LiveRegMatrix.h - Track register interference ----------&#42;- C++ -&#42;---===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The LiveRegMatrix analysis pass keeps track of virtual register interference</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// along two dimensions: Slot indexes and register units. The matrix is used by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register allocators to ensure that no interfering virtual registers get</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assigned to overlapping physical registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Register units are defined in MCRegisterInfo.h, they represent the smallest</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unit of interference when dealing with overlapping physical registers. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LiveRegMatrix is represented as a LiveIntervalUnion per register unit. When</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a virtual register is assigned to a physical register, the live range for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the virtual register is inserted into the LiveIntervalUnion for each regunit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the physreg.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;LIVEREGMATRIX&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;LIVEREGMATRIX&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/bitvector-h">llvm/ADT/BitVector.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// No interference, go ahead and assign.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix/#ab317b81a1c575049207d5d9348d8635aa58056f4f8345af4ca8bd6e27f0ff8413"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix/#ab317b81a1c575049207d5d9348d8635aa58056f4f8345af4ca8bd6e27f0ff8413">IK&#95;Free</a> = 0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Virtual register interference. There are interfering virtual registers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// assigned to PhysReg or its aliases. This interference could be resolved</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// by unassigning those other virtual registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix/#ab317b81a1c575049207d5d9348d8635aa30186d61b40f517e8dc5d9e85076a91f"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix/#ab317b81a1c575049207d5d9348d8635aa30186d61b40f517e8dc5d9e85076a91f">IK&#95;VirtReg</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Register unit interference. A fixed live range is in the way, typically</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// argument registers for a call. This can&#39;t be resolved by unassigning</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// other virtual registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix/#ab317b81a1c575049207d5d9348d8635aa471b00a6595e7f400ef576512ccbcc31"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix/#ab317b81a1c575049207d5d9348d8635aa471b00a6595e7f400ef576512ccbcc31">IK&#95;RegUnit</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// RegMask interference. The live range is crossing an instruction with a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// regmask operand that doesn&#39;t preserve PhysReg. This typically means</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// VirtReg is live across a call, and PhysReg isn&#39;t call-preserved.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix/#ab317b81a1c575049207d5d9348d8635aaa3c968c8898b0110e68e4933485c9042"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveregmatrix/#ab317b81a1c575049207d5d9348d8635aaa3c968c8898b0110e68e4933485c9042">IK&#95;RegMask</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Check for interference before assigning VirtReg to PhysReg.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If this function returns IK&#95;Free, it is legal to assign(VirtReg, PhysReg).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When there is more than one kind of interference, the InterferenceKind</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// with the highest enum value is returned.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Check for interference in the segment &#91;Start, End) that may prevent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// assignment to PhysReg. If this function returns true, there is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// interference in the segment &#91;Start, End) of some other interval already</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// assigned to PhysReg. If this function returns false, PhysReg is free at</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Check for interference in the segment &#91;Start, End) that may prevent</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// which lanes of the physical register interfere in the segment &#91;Start, End)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of some other interval already assigned to PhysReg.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If this function returns LaneBitmask::getNone(), PhysReg is completely</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// free at the segment &#91;Start, End).</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Assign VirtReg to PhysReg.</span></CodeLine>
